title: How I Set-up & Use Drip Irrigation

tasks.task: Setting up a drip irrigation system for ferns and palm trees.
subtasks: Organizing drip line materials (drip heads, tees, punch tool, couplers, clamps, timer zones).
Measuring and cutting drip line tubing.
Securing drip line tubing around the base of palm trees and ferns.
Attaching drip heads to the tubing using punch tool and couplers.
Adjusting drip head settings for appropriate water flow.
Configuring timers for optimal watering schedules (three times a day for ferns) based on soil type and weather conditions.
Connecting irrigation systems to existing water sources (faucet or misters) and troubleshooting leaks.
Installing and testing the new drip irrigation system to ensure proper water distribution.
Discussing the benefits of using adjustable drip heads and quarter-inch tubing for various watering needs.
